DS.DateTransform Class

Extends DS.Transform
Defined in: addon/transforms/date.js:3
Module: ember-data

The DS.DateTransform class is used to serialize and deserialize date attributes on Ember Data record objects. This transform is used when date is passed as the type parameter to the DS.attr function. It uses the ISO 8601 standard.

import DS from 'ember-data';

export default DS.Model.extend({
   value: DS.attr('number'),
   player: DS.belongsTo('player'),
   date: DS.attr('date')
 });
  • Index
  • Methods

Item Index

Methods

  • deserialize
  • serialize

Methods

deserialize

(
  • serialized
  • options
)

Inherited from DS.Transform: addon/transforms/transform.js:92

When given a serialized value from a JSON object this method must return the deserialized value for the record attribute. Example `javascript deserialize(serialized, options) { return empty(serialized) ? null : Number(serialized); } `

Parameters:

  • serialized Object
    The serialized value
  • options Object
    hash of options passed to DS.attr

Returns:

The deserialized value

serialize

(
  • deserialized
  • options
)

Inherited from DS.Transform: addon/transforms/transform.js:71

When given a deserialized value from a record attribute this method must return the serialized value. Example `javascript import { isEmpty } from '@ember/utils'; serialize(deserialized, options) { return isEmpty(deserialized) ? null : Number(deserialized); } `

Parameters:

  • deserialized Object
    The deserialized value
  • options Object
    hash of options passed to DS.attr

Returns:

The serialized value
